title: Copper rock

properties.name: description
properties.value: A copper rock is a rock that contains copper ore. It can be mined with a Mining level of 1. It is one of the first rocks that can be mined, along with tin rocks. Each time a player successfully mines a copper rock they gain 17.5 Mining experience. Mining 14 tin ore and 14 copper ore (wielding the pickaxe as a weapon to free the 28th inventory space) and smelting them to bronze bars is a slow but effective way to train Mining and Smithing.

Released4 January 2001 (Update)

ExamineA rocky outcrop.
Advanced data
Object ID11161

A copper rock is a rock that contains copper ore. It can be mined with a Mining level of 1. It is one of the first rocks that can be mined, along with tin rocks. Each time a player successfully mines a copper rock they gain 17.5 Mining experience. Mining 14 tin ore and 14 copper ore (wielding the pickaxe as a weapon to free the 28th inventory space) and smelting them to bronze bars is a slow but effective way to train Mining and Smithing.

For members, it is not really known that players can power level the Mining skill with copper ore in the Port Khazard mine and amass ore. This is because of two fast respawning copper rocks that are very close to a bank deposit box. These two copper rocks are the closest mining rocks to a fast bank source, which surpasses the West Falador mine and level 5 Agility shortcut.

On the other hand, free players can best gather their ores at East Varrock Mine and banking at Varrock East Bank. There is an aggressive level 6 giant rat for players under 13 combat en route to the bank, however.

Mining Info[edit | edit source]

Copper rock
Level required 1
Mining XP17.5 xp
Required toolPickaxe
Respawn time2.4 seconds

Pre roll drops[edit | edit source]

A gem table rolls before the main drop table.[1] There's a chance to receive nothing here so that players can receive no items from a rock even if they are guaranteed to receive an ore in the main drop table.[2] The table gets more likely to be rolled if the player has a glory amulet equipped: the probability grows from 1/256 to 1/86.[3]

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
NothingN/A70/32,768; 70/11,008[d 1]N/AN/A
Uncut sapphire132/32,768; 32/11,008[d 1]35615
Uncut emerald116/32,768; 16/11,008[d 1]57630
Uncut ruby18/32,768; 8/11,008[d 1]1,25660
Uncut diamond12/32,768; 2/11,008[d 1]2,866120
  1. ^ 1.0 1.1 1.2 1.3 1.4 The drop rate is increased while wearing an amulet of glory

Main drops[edit | edit source]

The probability for a player to receive a copper ore drop depends on the player's mining level. The rock will deplete after receiving the copper ore.

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Copper ore1Always951

Conditional drops[edit | edit source]

The following table shows items that can be received in addition to the main resource.

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Clue geode (beginner)1RareNot soldN/A
Clue geode (easy)1RareNot soldN/A
Clue geode (medium)1RareNot soldN/A
Clue geode (hard)1RareNot soldN/A
Clue geode (elite)1RareNot soldN/A
Rock golem1Very rareNot soldN/A

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 11 February 2020. (Archived from the original on 27 November 2020.) Mod Ash: "It adds a gem roll before each ore roll, and if you receive a gem you don't get the ore roll."
  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 6 July 2020. (Archived from the original on 27 November 2020.) Mod Ash: "Yes, [the mining gem table has] got [...] chance of giving no gem."
  3. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 7 Feb 2017. (Archived from the original on 18 Jun 2019.) Mod Ash: "[the actual increase when wearing the Amulet of Glory while mining is] 1/86 rather than 1/256 for a gem."
